intro: Cheiranthera parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered cheiranthera, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or undergrowth. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
